statement.p: Natasha is conducting market research on the cost of homeowners insurance. Natasha has determined that the average annual cost of homeowners insurance is 1199, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 89.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends more than 1064 on homeowners insurance.
b. The cost of the middle 50 of homeowners insurance policies falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 10 of homeowners insurance policies cost at least how much annually?

b. For the middle 50 of the data, need the remaining 50 of the data split between the left and right tails of the distribution. So the lower bound of the range has \displaystyle{0.25} of the area to the left and the upper bound of the range has \displaystyle{0.25} of the area to the right, which means \displaystyle{0.75} to the left.
